cell.html: Lost the broadcast rights in Baton Rouge to the now ESPN 1300 in February 2007.
cell.text: Lost the broadcast rights in Baton Rouge to the now ESPN 1300 in February 2007.

cell.html: Since the year 2000, ESPN Radio bounced between the two competing Detroit sports stations. In August 2007, ESPN attempted (without success) to break their contract with WDFN to move back to WXYT. Despite still having a current contract with WDFN, ESPN Radio began broadcasting on WXYT anyway, with both stations carrying ESPN Radio content simultaneously. In October 2007 when WXYT merged with sister station WKRK , they dropped ESPN Radio in lieu of Sporting News Radio . WDFN then immediately granted ESPN's request to break their contract, leaving Detroit without an ESPN Radio affiliate.
cell.text: Since the year 2000, ESPN Radio bounced between the two competing Detroit sports stations. In August 2007, ESPN attempted (without success) to break their contract with WDFN to move back to WXYT. Despite still having a current contract with WDFN, ESPN Radio began broadcasting on WXYT anyway, with both stations carrying ESPN Radio content simultaneously. In October 2007 when WXYT merged with sister station WKRK , they dropped ESPN Radio in lieu of Sporting News Radio . WDFN then immediately granted ESPN's request to break their contract, leaving Detroit without an ESPN Radio affiliate.

cell.html: WNEZ AM 910 carried The Fabulous Sports Babe until December 1996 when the station was sold and went Spanish and later Urban Contemporary. The station is now Spanish Tropical Mega 910 WLAT . ESPN Radio has been on WPOP since 1998 when that station dumped the One on One Sports network.

cell.html: Changed formats to religious, with ESPN now heard on WJXL ; Atlanta Braves baseball still carried live
cell.text: Changed formats to religious, with ESPN now heard on WJXL ; Atlanta Braves baseball still carried live

cell.html: Formerly KCMX, now a Christian radio station. ESPN programs moved to 810 WHB . Former flagship of the Kansas City Royals
cell.text: Formerly KCMX, now a Christian radio station. ESPN programs moved to 810 WHB . Former flagship of the Kansas City Royals
Swapped with then Radio Disney 710 in 2003
Defunct since 2002, broadcasting the Trenton Thunder

cell.html: WKNR was the first affiliate in Cleveland and carried weekend programming until WWWE (which changed callsigns to WTAM) picked it up in 1995. WTAM then moved the affiliation to WKNR in 1998 (when both stations were under common ownership); WKNR carried ESPN Radio until its cancellation by the network in July 2006 which was effective that October. WWGK's new ownership then purchased WKNR in December 2006, and moved it back to WKNR in March 2007, but WWGK airs ESPN programming and play-by-play that WKNR is unable to air due to other commitments.
cell.text: WKNR was the first affiliate in Cleveland and carried weekend programming until WWWE (which changed callsigns to WTAM) picked it up in 1995. WTAM then moved the affiliation to WKNR in 1998 (when both stations were under common ownership); WKNR carried ESPN Radio until its cancellation by the network in July 2006 which was effective that October. WWGK's new ownership then purchased WKNR in December 2006, and moved it back to WKNR in March 2007, but WWGK airs ESPN programming and play-by-play that WKNR is unable to air due to other commitments.

cell.html: Defunct since July 2006, moved to Triple X ESPN Radio . Had been the flagship of The Tony Kornheiser Show (now originates independently at WWWT ) and Andy Pollin was also a past contributor to the network.
cell.text: Defunct since July 2006, moved to Triple X ESPN Radio . Had been the flagship of The Tony Kornheiser Show (now originates independently at WWWT ) and Andy Pollin was also a past contributor to the network.

cell.html: WAUK was purchased by Good Karma Broadcasting in 2004, and took up the ESPN Radio affiliation, but due to being on a clear-channel frequency reserved to WLAC in Nashville, it was and is only able to broadcast during the daytime hours. WMCS (which once held the WMVP calls until being purchased by the 1000 kHz Chicago facility) aired shows at night starting in 2005 via a leased-time arragement. The format moved to WRRD as "540 ESPN" in February 2008; a future format (or affiliation) for WAUK is to be determined. The leased-time arrangement with WMCS was set to expire late in 2008.
cell.text: WAUK was purchased by Good Karma Broadcasting in 2004, and took up the ESPN Radio affiliation, but due to being on a clear-channel frequency reserved to WLAC in Nashville, it was and is only able to broadcast during the daytime hours. WMCS (which once held the WMVP calls until being purchased by the 1000 kHz Chicago facility) aired shows at night starting in 2005 via a leased-time arragement. The format moved to WRRD as "540 ESPN" in February 2008; a future format (or affiliation) for WAUK is to be determined. The leased-time arrangement with WMCS was set to expire late in 2008.

cell.html: Purchased by Simmons Media, leased to Nova M Radio, a group that leases stations to run Air America Radio programming.
cell.text: Purchased by Simmons Media, leased to Nova M Radio, a group that leases stations to run Air America Radio programming.

cell.html: Later became a progressive talk station and Air America Radio affiliate; today, it is a time-shifted version of co-owned 870WWL .
cell.text: Later became a progressive talk station and Air America Radio affiliate; today, it is a time-shifted version of co-owned 870WWL .

cell.html: Switched to Fox Sports Radio in December 2007
cell.text: Switched to Fox Sports Radio in December 2007

cell.html: Became Fox Sports Radio in February 2008 in a three-way switch in which KWWN became the new ESPN Radio station and KENO joined ESPN Deportes Radio

cell.html: Formerly affiliate for La Salle University Basketball, Temple Owls football coverage. Replaced by ESPN 1040 (New York)
cell.text: Formerly affiliate for La Salle University Basketball, Temple Owls football coverage. Replaced by ESPN 1040 (New York)

cell.html: The Score AM-FM was Providence's home of ESPN Radio until 3/11/08. 99.7 FM flipped to a simulcast of NewsTalk 630 as WEAN-FM . 790 AM flipped to The True Oldies Channel on 3/18/08. There has yet to be an announcement about a replacement ESPN Radio affiliate for Rhode Island .

context.text: List of ESPN Radio affiliates - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Market Branding Special Local Programming Notes
The following is the list of radio stations that were previously ESPN Radio affiliates.
Market Branding Special Local Programming Notes

In August 2007, ESPN attempted (without success) to break their contract with WDFN to move back to WXYT. Despite still having a current contract with WDFN, ESPN Radio began broadcasting on WXYT anyway, with both stations carrying ESPN Radio content simultaneously. In October 2007 when WXYT merged with sister station WKRK, they dropped ESPN Radio in lieu of Sporting News Radio. WDFN then immediately granted ESPN's request to break their contract, leaving Detroit without an ESPN Radio affiliate.

(2006-2007)		WKNR was the first affiliate in Cleveland and carried weekend programming until WWWE (which changed callsigns to WTAM) picked it up in 1995. WTAM then moved the affiliation to WKNR in 1998 (when both stations were under common ownership); WKNR carried ESPN Radio until its cancellation by the network in July 2006 which was effective that October. WWGK's new ownership then purchased WKNR in December 2006, and moved it back to WKNR in March 2007, but WWGK airs ESPN programming and play-by-play that WKNR is unable to air due to other commitments.

WMCS (which once held the WMVP calls until being purchased by the 1000 kHz Chicago facility) aired shows at night starting in 2005 via a leased-time arragement.
